messages.content: Help Relationship Identifier
Ok, I am going to look into generators when I can make time will reach out if I have questions‚Ä¶ thank you..

Generator run against a targets so another group. 
but you can have "whatever" in your query, so as soon as the devices are link to anything like a Site, or an Organization, and you did have a group with those objects, you can query the devices and have the generator add them to groups
Ok, I haven‚Äôt gotten around to looking at generators yet, but is this something I can solve using a generator? To get a list of all devices and the customer relationship and add them as members?
I would say yes. We are using `members`  relationship for the Artifact, we can't track a custom relationship in a group for this purpose at the moment
Is this expected behavior?
so to troubleshoot, i added the device as a member of the group, and that successfully generate the artifact for the only switch I added as a member
I have an artifact tied to the `targets: "CumulusSwitches"`... but when i generate the artifact, the task completes successfully, but i notices the artifact was not showing up on the Device menu..
Hey, Just noticed something and I am not sure if it is expected behavior.. So with the extentions configured, i can now add devices to groups.. and it shows up as below..

After a quick browse in the documentation, indeed, we spoke about it very briefly in the reference > schema > node extension

but there is no mention of it in Guides or Topics.

Adding an issue to track it
ok, the extensions was pretty straightforward.. but i did not find any documentation on it in the docs..
i am going to try writing an extention today and will get back in case i run into issues..

I think the detailed view is ok, yeah i have not gotten deep enough into generators, have read the documentation a couple of times but have not attmepted to write one yet.. that next on my TODO list..
For a more ‚Äúautomated‚Äù way , you could have a generator , adding devices to groups based on type / platform etc
The group management button on the device ‚Äúdetailed view‚Äù is not handy enough in your opinion ? We have an issue to track be able to add node to group from the edit/creation form

ok, here is my though.. if there is a better way, i am all ears.. 

This would be so that one can add a device to a group without have to navigate to `Object Management` in the UI.. I am tying all my transformations to the group.. 

Now, having said that, i also have a platform that my device is related to, and i would have loved to create a group of all devices that have the same platform and have artifacts generated for it but have not been able to figure out how to get it working..
I'm curious as to what you're trying to solve here?
You'd use the `extensions` in the schema file. Here is an example: https://github.com/opsmill/schema-library/blob/main/extensions/qinq/qinq.yaml

messages.content:
Sorry, quick question about schema again.. 
For devices, i am creating a relationship to a CoreStandardGroup like below

```
      - name: group
        identifier: "group__devices"
        label: Groups Groups
        peer: CoreStandardGroup
        kind: Generic
        optional: true
        cardinality: one
```

when i do this, i can see a drop down in the devices menu to select a group (which i have created).. 

However, when i go to the groups, i am looking for the device to be added as a member, and I dont see it being added? 

I am guessing i need to add the device as a relationship to the CoreStandardGroup? does anyone have an example of how i can define it?

The identifier is automatically generated for you, but it is what ties the two relationships together and allows you to traverse them.

Do you have a specific question or issue you ran into?
yeah, i have read that document so many times, everytime i look at it a little more makes sense.. thank you..
Have you seen this doc? https://docs.infrahub.app/topics/schema#direction-and-identifier-in-relationships

embeds.title: Schema | Infrahub Documentation
embeds.description: In Infrahub, the schema is at the center of most things and our goal is to provide as much flexibility as possible to allow users to extend and customize the schema.

messages.content: and even in attributes.. i am guessing they serve similar purposes?
yes, on a relationship..
On a relationship ?
can someone help me understand how to use the `identifier` field?
let me give these a go.. i have never though of everthing in database terms.. its all new to me and i am just taking a while to wrap my head around it..
I don‚Äôt think you had to remove the relationship in site, but you may have to have it as optional as you are setting them from the device everytime i guess

referenced_message.content: ok, i sorted.. i had to get rid of the `cardinality: many` relationship in the Site... It sorta makes sense now..

messages.content:
To be able to use {id: <name>} you need to have the name as default_filter.

This was the method before we introduce HFID. Nowadays we recommend using HFID

referenced_message.content:
now, i tried this in the GraphQL sandbox. and in the place of `site: { id` i use `site: {hfid` and the mutation is successful.. 

What am i missing?

messages.content: You could also set the `kind` on the InfraDevice side to `Parent` as well which allows filtering for the device by picking a site first.
Your code looks correct with you fetching the site and then passing it in.

Hm. I'm not sure that should have been the problem.

What if you change it back to `many` and kind of `Generic` ?
ok, i sorted.. i had to get rid of the `cardinality: many` relationship in the Site... It sorta makes sense now..
however i get `ValueError: Unexpected format for site found a <class 'infrahub_sdk.node.OrganisationSiteInfrahubNodeSync'>, Queensberry Street`
that is what my code looks like now..

ok, i kind of rubber ducked a part of my issue.. I was just passing in the `hfid` reading through the SDK documentation, i figured i need to get the config of site and pass in the config? if i am working this right...

```
def load_devices(data: dict) -> None:
    print(f"[cyan] => Creating {data['label']} [/cyan]")
    for device in data["items"]:
        site = client.get(kind="OrganisationSite", name__value=device["site"])
        print(type(site))
        print(vars(site))
        c = client.create(
            kind=data["kind"],
            hostname=device["name"],
            serialnumber=device["serial_number"],
            site=site,
        )
        c.save(allow_upsert=True)
```
That is why that upsert failed, but the sandbox one worked. What does your code look like?
The ID is the database ID (uuid).

now, i tried this in the GraphQL sandbox. and in the place of `site: { id` i use `site: {hfid` and the mutation is successful.. 

What am i missing?
The sites are present for sure..

so the schema loads successfully, no issues.. I am now trying to import some data using the SDK, here is the data. 

```
devices:
  kind: InfraDevice
  label: Devices
  items:
    - name: oob-switch-1
      serial_number: "123456"
      site: "Queensberry Street"
```

and 

```
  - name: Device
    namespace: Infra
    label: Devices
    description: Represents a network device.
    human_friendly_id:
      - name__value
    display_labels:
      - name__value
    order_by:
      - name__value
    uniqueness_constraints:
      - [name__value]
    attributes:
      - name: name
        kind: Text
        description: The name of the network device.
        optional: false
      - name: fqdn
        kind: Text
        description: The FQDN of the network device.
        computed_attribute:
          kind: Jinja2
          jinja2_template: "{{ name__value }}.unimelb.net.au"
        read_only: true
        optional: false
      - name: serial_number
        kind: Text
        description: The serial number of the network device.
        optional: true
      - name: description
        kind: Text
        description: A description of the network device.
        optional: true
    relationships:
      - name: site
        kind: Attribute
        peer: OrganisationSite
        cardinality: one
        optional: false
        description: The location of the network device.
```

```
# yaml-language-server: $schema=https://schema.infrahub.app/infrahub/schema/latest.json
version: "1.0"

nodes:
  - name: Site
    namespace: Organisation
    description: Represents a site of an organisation.
    human_friendly_id:
      - name__value
    display_labels:
      - name__value
    order_by:
      - name__value
    uniqueness_constraints:
      - [name__value]
    attributes:
      - name: name
        kind: Text
        description: The name of the site.
        optional: false
      - name: address
        kind: Text
        description: The address of the site.
        optional: false
      - name: site_code
        kind: Number
        description: The site code of the site.
        optional: false
      - name: contact_email
        kind: Text
        description: The contact information of the site.
        optional: true
      - name: contact_phone
        kind: Text
        description: The contact information of the site.
        optional: true
    relationships:
      - name: device
        peer: InfraDevice
        cardinality: many
        kind: Component
        description: The network devices of the site.
```
